1.text: And it came to pass on the eighth day, that Moses called Aaron and his sons, and the elders of Israel;

2.text: And he said to Aaron, Take thee a young calf for a sin-offering, and a ram for a burnt-offering, without blemish, and offer them before the LORD.

3.text: And to the children of Israel thou shalt speak, saying, Take ye a kid of the goats for a sin-offering; and a calf and a lamb, both of the first year, without blemish, for a burnt-offering;

4.text: Also a bullock and a ram for peace-offerings, to sacrifice before the LORD; and a meat-offering mingled with oil: for to-day the LORD will appear to you.

5.text: And they brought that which Moses commanded before the tabernacle of the congregation: and all the congregation drew near and stood before the LORD.

6.text: And Moses said, This is the thing which the LORD commanded that ye should do: and the glory of the LORD shall appear to you.

7.text: And Moses said to Aaron, Go to the altar, and offer thy sin-offering, and thy burnt-offering, and make an atonement for thyself, and for the people: and offer the offering of the people, and make an atonement for them; as the LORD commanded.

8.text: Aaron therefore went to the altar, and slew the calf of the sin-offering, which was for himself.

9.text: And the sons of Aaron brought the blood to him: and he dipped his finger in the blood, and put it upon the horns of the altar, and poured out the blood at the bottom of the altar:

10.text: But the fat, and the kidneys, and the caul above the liver of the sin-offering, he burnt upon the altar; as the LORD commanded Moses.

11.text: And the flesh and the hide he burnt with fire without the camp.

12.text: And he slew the burnt-offering; and Aaron’s sons presented to him the blood, which he sprinkled around upon the altar.

13.text: And they presented the burnt-offering to him, with the pieces of it, and the head: and he burnt them upon the altar.

14.text: And he washed the inwards and the legs, and burnt them upon the burnt-offering on the altar.

15.text: And he brought the people’s offering, and took the goat, which was the sin-offering for the people, and slew it, and offered it for sin, as the first.

16.text: And he brought the burnt-offering, and offered it according to the manner.

17.text: And he brought the meat-offering, and took a handful of it, and burnt it upon the altar, beside the burnt-sacrifice of the morning.

18.text: He slew also the bullock and the ram for a sacrifice of peace-offerings, which was for the people: and Aaron’s sons presented to him the blood, which he sprinkled around upon the altar,

19.text: And the fat of the bullock, and of the ram, the rump, and that which covereth the inwards, and the kidneys, and the caul above the liver:

20.text: And they put the fat upon the breasts, and he burnt the fat upon the altar:

21.text: And the breasts and the right shoulder Aaron waved for a wave-offering before the LORD; as Moses commanded.

22.text: And Aaron lifted up his hand towards the people, and blessed them; and came down from offering the sin-offering, and the burnt-offering, and peace-offerings.

23.text: And Moses and Aaron went into the tabernacle of the congregation, and came out, and blessed the people: and the glory of the LORD appeared to all the people.

24.text: And there came out a fire from before the LORD, and consumed upon the altar the burnt-offering and the fat: which, when all the people saw, they shouted, and fell on their faces.
